entries.summary:
【注意】自动汇总失败，下方为合并摘要拼接，请人工复核。

合并摘要 1：
好的，这是对第 1/5 分段推文的分析提炼：

*   AI 行业分析/OpenAI 商业模式 —— 深度分析揭示了 OpenAI 的“AI 泡沫经济学”：尽管面临巨额亏损和仅 5% 的付费用户转化率，公司仍承诺对基础设施进行万亿美元级别的投入，显示出其高风险的“先规模化，后盈利”战略；原文：「When a company losing $8 billion annually while serving 95% non-paying users commits $1 trillion to infrastructure buildout, it represents the ultimate expression of AI bubble economics.」

*   AI 安全/企业责任 —— 社区对 Sam Altman 关于 AI 风险的言论持批判态度，将其解读为一种“先部署，后道歉”的策略，认为这实质上是将技术失控的风险和后果转嫁给公众；原文：「This isn't a warning. It's a confession. He has admitted his strategy: Deploy first, apologize later.」

*   AI 工具用法/工作流 —— 用户分享了实用工作流，建议根据任务不同选择特定模型，例如使用 ChatGPT 进行研究和构思，而使用 Gemini 进行文本撰写，体现了多工具组合使用的趋势；原文：「リサーチ→ChatGPT thinking 文章作成→Gemini...AIも適材適所が大事なので、少なくともChatGPTとGeminiは両方課金して使い分けるのがおすすめです。」

*   AI 模型对比/审查机制 —— 用户在处理敏感或技术性任务时，对不同 AI 的审查严格度进行了比较，其中 Grok 因其限制较少而受到青睐，被视为完成 Claude 和 ChatGPT 因安全限制而拒绝的任务的“终极杀器”；原文：「Claude搭建VPN居然说，翻墙非法拒绝提供任何思路...Grok现在成了终极杀器了。」

*   AI 模型更新/社区传闻 —— 社区中出现关于 OpenAI 可能已部署 “GPT-5-Codex” 微小更新的猜测，此举被认为是为应对即将发布的竞品 Gemini 3，反映出社区对 AI 技术竞赛的高度关注；原文：「OpenAI GPT-5-Codex 似乎刚部署了一个小更新。...我怀疑是为了 counter 下周 Gemini 3 发布做准备」

*   AI 伦理/Sora —— 社区在讨论 OpenAI 暂停 Sora 生成特定历史人物图像的事件，并质疑其产品发布是否过于仓促、缺少必要的安全护栏，或是一种精心策划的公关策略；原文：「Did OpenAI rush Sora 2 without proper guardrails, or was it Sam Altman masterclass move to let people generate whatever they wanted for the first two days?」

合并摘要 2：
好的，这是对第 2/5 分段推文的 AI 相关重点信息提炼：

*   **AI 军事应用 —— 结论：AI 正在被用于严肃的、高风险的决策支持场景，一位美国陆军将军承认使用 ChatGPT 辅助关键指挥决策，这标志着 AI 技术在核心机构中的信任度和采纳程度达到了新的水平；原文：「U.S. Army general admits he uses ChatGPT to help support “key command decisions.”」**

*   **AI Agent 趋势 —— 结论：社区普遍认为 “AI Agent 时代” 已经到来，并预测 2025 年将是其爆发年，从宏观趋势讨论到具体的 SEO 自动化工作流，AI Agent 已成为一个热门的开发和讨论方向；原文：「The AI Agent era is here — and 2025 is their breakout year! ... this visual cheatsheet breaks down the top AI trends shaping the future.」**

*   **高级 AI 使用技巧 —— 结论：一位日本用户提出深刻洞见，批评将 ChatGPT 当作“宠物”的浅层用法，并提倡通过“培养”（调整设定）使其转变为输出稳定的专业“秘书”或“工匠”，以实现效率的飞跃；原文：「ChatGPTをペット扱いで終わらせてる人、多すぎる。...ほんの少し設定をいじるだけで秘書にも職人にもかわって出力のブレも激減する。」**

*   **社区情绪与讨论 —— 结论：在 ChatGPT 发布近三年之际，社区开始反思其带来的社会影响，并出现一种“世界正在快速分裂”的论调，将人们划分为 AI 的支持者与反对者两大阵营；原文：「Almost 3 years since ChatGPT changed the game Are you for AI or against it? The world’s dividing fast — pick your side.」**

*   **社区变现模式 —— 结论：将 AI 工具（特别是 ChatGPT）用于内容创作和数字产品设计，并通过社交媒体和自由职业平台变现，已成为一种广为流传的“零投资”在线赚钱模式；原文：「Use ChatGPT to write blogs, eBooks, & social media content. Use Canva to design posts... Sell on Etsy, Fiverr, or social media. Zero investment.」**

*   **AI 的新奇用法 —— 结论：ChatGPT 被应用于日常生活中的偶然性事件，例如生成彩票号码，并意外地促成了一次 10 万美元的中奖事件，这成为了一个病毒式传播的 AI 应用案例；原文：「MICHIGAN WOMAN WINS $100K POWERBALL USING NUMBERS FROM CHATGPT」**

合并摘要 3：
好的，这是对第 3/5 分段推文的分析：

*   **AI 代理情绪趋势 —— 社区对 AI 代理的看法正快速转变，曾经的怀疑论者现在也因 Claude 等产品的能力而认可其价值；原文：「Huh, I guess I went from "agents are meaningless jargon hype that's never going to happen" in January to "Claude Code is a General Agent" in October」**
*   **新产品: Claude Skills —— Anthropic 为其代码模型推出的扩展功能，允许用户通过添加“技能”（预打包指令）来增强其能力，例如处理 Word 文档；原文：「Skills allow you to extend Claude Code in new ways using pre-packaged instructions and code. For example, add the docx skill to let Claude Code create word documents.」**
*   **新产品: Shortcut —— 一款自称是目前世界上最好的电子表格/Excel AI 代理，并在 Spreadsheet Bench 上首个获得 SOTA 认证；原文：「Shortcut is the best Spreadsheet/Excel AI agent in the world」**
*   **应用案例: Box AI + Claude Skills —— 一个值得关注的用法是将 AI 代理与新技能结合，以解决更复杂的知识工作，例如 Box AI 利用 Claude Skills 从现有数据直接生成 PowerPoint 文件；原文：「Here's an example of Box AI with the new Claude Skills to generate a clean powerpoint file from existing data.」**
*   **行业趋势: Web3 AI 代理兴起 —— 多个 AI 代理产品开始涌现，专注于 Web3 领域，提供钱包管理、游戏 NPC、加密分析等专业功能；原文：「Flippy is coming to Telegram... a versatile wallet agent across 32+ chains...」或「@GiantAI_agent is the world’s first sentient AI-Agent, interoperable across Decentralized Games, Web2, and Web3.」**
*   **高价值洞察: Claude Skills 的意义 —— 社区认为 Claude Skills 是一次重大发布，它为构建可行的 AI 代理提供了一条更简单的路径，是 AI 能力的又一次飞跃；原文：「Claude Skills are a big deal, representing both an easy path for workable agents & a step forward in what AI can do.」**

合并摘要 4：
好的，这是对第 4/5 分段推文的 AI 相关重点信息提炼：

*   **社区趋势 “AI 代理战争” ——** 社区热议 OpenAI、Anthropic、xAI、Google 等巨头已进入“AI 代理战争”阶段，AI 正从“便利工具”转变为能自主工作的代理，这是一个重要的行业转变趋势，值得高度关注；原文：「OpenAI、Anthropic、xAI、Googleが“AIエージェント戦争”に突入。自律行動するAIがあなたの代わりに仕事する時代。」

*   **新产品 Alpha Report Keywords ——** 出现了一款利用 LLM 的新工具，它能通过关键词搜索非结构化数据并自动生成高级报告，展示了 LLM 在数据分析和报告自动化方面的应用潜力；原文：「You can now search Alpha Reports with any keyword! This will trigger our LLM @LurkyReverb to search through all of the data we have collected and generate high level reports...」

*   **社区讨论 Anthropic 的创新与偏见 ——** 社区对 Anthropic 的讨论呈现两面性：一方面认可其在 LLM 应用和人机交互方面的持续创新，另一方面则有声音强烈指责其存在严重的左翼政治偏见；原文：「...Anthropic was the first to introduce: Projects...Canvas...and now Skills...we cannot say that they don't actively innovate...」「...its leadership, financial backing, and even the tech itself, all reveal a disturbing left-wing political bias.」

*   **市场情绪 AI 股市泡沫 ——** 市场出现对 AI 投机狂热的担忧，有观点认为由保证金债务飙升驱动的 AI 泡沫非常危险，一旦破裂可能加剧金融危机；原文：「The AI bubble in the US stock market is driven by a speculative frenzy that is very dangerous. Margin debt...has spiked to new highs.」

*   **高价值资源 AI 学习包 ——** 社区中出现通过免费赠送“AI 精通捆绑包”（包含 ChatGPT 指南、3000+ 提示词、副业指南等）来吸引关注和互动的营销方式，这类资源对初学者有一定价值；原文：「$299 AI Mastery Bundle — FREE Today...Includes: • ChatGPT Bible • 3000+ Prompts • AI Side Hustle Guides...」

*   **投资洞察 AI 基础设施 ——** 有投资者提出，与追逐短期热点不同，投资于 AI 基础设施（如 @MorphwareAI）是更稳健的策略，因为矿工和大型机构对基础设施有长期需求；原文：「Money will flow in with all the miners and big institutions that want an AI infrastructure.」

合并摘要 5：
• AIGC Meme Generation —— 社区对 AI 生成 Meme 迎来“硬核升级”感到兴奋，认为其能创造出非常新潮的内容；原文：「GBoy memes are looking fresh aF. AIGC about to level up hard.」

Sam Altman just committed over $1 trillion to AI infrastructure in the past month alone, while OpenAI lost $8 billion in the first half of 2025 despite doubling revenue. Only 5% of ChatGPT's 800 million users pay for subscriptions, and Altman admits profitability isn't in his "top ten concerns" despite the company's desperate search for new revenue streams.

The Revenue Reality Check
OpenAI can't convince 95% of users that ChatGPT is worth $20 monthly, yet they're planning to spend more than many countries' GDP on infrastructure. The company is now exploring advertising, monetizing Sora video generation, online shopping integration, and even reversing course on "mature apps" to boost engagement after previously rejecting "sexbots."

The Circular Financing Web
OpenAI is using Nvidia investment money to buy Nvidia chips while relying on partners like Oracle to absorb infrastructure costs and give them "time to build the business." Senior executives admit there's "lots of fuzz on the horizon" regarding their five-year business model, with no concrete plan to monetize resource-intensive products like Sora.

The Systemic Risk
AI capital expenditures now contribute more to US economic growth than all consumer spending combined, meaning an OpenAI collapse could trigger broader economic damage. The company's strategy appears to be scaling infrastructure first and figuring out monetization later, despite burning through billions with no clear path to sustainability.

My Take
When a company losing $8 billion annually while serving 95% non-paying users commits $1 trillion to infrastructure buildout, it represents the ultimate expression of AI bubble economics. Altman's admission that profitability isn't a top concern while the broader economy depends on AI capex reveals how disconnected current investment levels are from business fundamentals. The circular financing arrangements and reliance on partners to absorb costs suggest OpenAI knows its unit economics don't work at current scale.

Hedgie  仅在过去一个月，Sam Altman 就刚刚承诺向人工智能基础设施投入超过 1 万亿美元，而 OpenAI 尽管收入翻了一番，但在 2025 年上半年仍亏损了 80 亿美元。ChatGPT 的 8 亿用户中只有 5% 支付订阅费用，Altman 承认，尽管该公司拼命寻找新的收入来源，但盈利能力并不在他的“十大担忧”之列。

收入现实检查
OpenAI 无法让 95% 的用户相信 ChatGPT 每月价值 20 美元，但他们计划在基础设施上的支出超过许多国家的 GDP。该公司现在正在探索广告、通过 Sora 视频生成获利、在线购物集成，甚至在之前拒绝“性爱机器人”后扭转“成熟应用程序”的方向，以提高参与度。

循环融资网
OpenAI 正在使用英伟达的投资资金购买英伟达芯片，同时依靠甲骨文等合作伙伴来吸收基础设施成本并给他们“时间来建立业务”。高级管理人员承认，他们的五年商业模式“有很多模糊”，没有具体计划将 Sora 等资源密集型产品货币化。

系统性风险
人工智能资本支出现在对美国经济增长的贡献超过了所有消费者支出的总和，这意味着 OpenAI 的崩溃可能会引发更广泛的经济损失。该公司的战略似乎是首先扩大基础设施规模，然后再考虑货币化，尽管已经耗尽了数十亿美元，但没有明确的可持续发展途径。

我的看法
当一家公司在为 95% 的非付费用户提供服务的同时每年亏损 80 亿美元，承诺投入 1 万亿美元用于基础设施建设时，这代表了人工智能泡沫经济学的终极体现。奥特曼承认，盈利能力并不是首要问题，而更广泛的经济依赖于人工智能资本支出，这揭示了当前的投资水平与业务基本面是多么脱节。循环融资安排和依赖合作伙伴来吸收成本表明，OpenAI 知道其单位经济学在当前规模下行不通。

Here’s Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, saying the quiet part out loud.

He isn't warning about AI risk. He's managing the public's expectations for a disaster he is actively building.

Let's translate his serene, tech-bro fatalism:

- On AGI: "It will go whooshing by... It won't actually be the singularity."

What he's REALLY saying: "The god-like intelligence we're building will be absorbed so seamlessly into corporate infrastructure that you won't even get to vote on it. The 'revolution' will be a subscription service."

- On Societal Impact: "Society will learn faster... people and societies are all just so much more adaptable than we think."

What he's REALLY saying: "When we disrupt entire industries and erase millions of jobs, you'll just have to 'adapt.' Your pain is a necessary cost for our progress. Be resilient."

- On the Inevitability of Disaster: "I expect some really bad stuff to happen... we'll develop some guardrails around it as a society."

What he's REALLY saying: "We are moving too fast to bother with safety. We will break things, including possibly your society. You, the public, will be left to build the 'guardrails' and clean up the mess after we've already cashed out."

This isn't a warning. It's a confession.

He has admitted his strategy: Deploy first, apologize later. The "fire" he's playing with is an intelligence he doesn't understand, and his business model depends on you getting burned.这是 OpenAI 首席执行官 Sam Altman 大声说出安静的部分。

他并没有警告人工智能风险。他正在管理公众对他正在积极制造的灾难的期望。

让我们翻译一下他平静的、科技兄弟的宿命论：

- 关于 AGI：“它会嗖嗖地过去......它实际上不会是奇点。

他真正在说的是：“我们正在构建的神一样的智能将无缝地吸收到企业基础设施中，以至于你甚至无法对其进行投票。'革命'将是一项订阅服务。

- 关于社会影响：“社会会学得更快......人们和社会的适应性都比我们想象的要强得多。

他真正想说的是：“当我们颠覆整个行业并消除数百万个工作岗位时，你只需要'适应'。您的痛苦是我们进步的必要代价。要有弹性。

- 关于灾难的不可避免性：“我预计会发生一些非常糟糕的事情......作为一个社会，我们将围绕它制定一些护栏。

他真正在说的是：“我们行动太快了，无法为安全而烦恼。我们会破坏一些东西，可能包括你们的社会。你们，公众，在我们兑现后，将不得不建造'护栏'并收拾烂摊子。

这不是警告。这是一个忏悔。

他承认了自己的策略：先部署，后道歉。他玩弄的“火”是他不懂的智能，他的商业模式全靠你被烧伤。

MICHIGAN WOMAN WINS $100K POWERBALL USING NUMBERS FROM CHATGPT

Tammy Carvey, 45, from Wyandotte just proved AI can do everything except guarantee lottery wins - but sometimes it gets close enough.

When the jackpot hit $1 billion, she asked ChatGPT for numbers. 

The AI delivered: four white balls and the Powerball matched, landing her $50,000 that doubled to $100K with Power Play.

"My husband and I were in total disbelief," Carvey said after claiming her prize at Michigan Lottery headquarters. 

She's planning to pay off their home.

Before everyone floods ChatGPT with lottery requests: The odds were still 1 in 913,129. 

The AI didn't crack the lottery code - Carvey just got astronomically lucky with random numbers that happened to come from a chatbot.

Still beats using birthdays and anniversaries like the rest of us suckers.

Source: CBS Detroit  密歇根州女子使用 CHATGPT 的号码赢得 100 美元的强力球

来自怀恩多特的 45 岁的塔米·卡维 （Tammy Carvey） 刚刚证明了人工智能可以做任何事情，除了保证彩票中奖——但有时它已经足够接近了。

当头奖达到 10 亿美元时，她向 ChatGPT 索要数字。

人工智能交付了：四个白球和强力球匹配，她获得了 50,000 美元，通过 Power Play 翻了一番，达到 100 美元。

“我和我丈夫完全难以置信，”卡维在密歇根彩票总部领奖后说。

她正计划还清他们的房子。

在每个人都向 ChatGPT 发送彩票请求之前：几率仍然是 1 分之 913,129。

人工智能没有破解彩票密码——卡维只是天文数字般幸运，随机数字恰好来自聊天机器人。

仍然像我们其他人一样使用生日和周年纪念日。

Sam Altman just committed over $1 trillion to AI infrastructure in the past month alone, while OpenAI lost $8 billion in the first half of 2025 despite doubling revenue. Only 5% of ChatGPT's 800 million users pay for subscriptions, and Altman admits profitability isn't in his "top ten concerns" despite the company's desperate search for new revenue streams.

The Revenue Reality Check
OpenAI can't convince 95% of users that ChatGPT is worth $20 monthly, yet they're planning to spend more than many countries' GDP on infrastructure. The company is now exploring advertising, monetizing Sora video generation, online shopping integration, and even reversing course on "mature apps" to boost engagement after previously rejecting "sexbots."

The Circular Financing Web
OpenAI is using Nvidia investment money to buy Nvidia chips while relying on partners like Oracle to absorb infrastructure costs and give them "time to build the business." Senior executives admit there's "lots of fuzz on the horizon" regarding their five-year business model, with no concrete plan to monetize resource-intensive products like Sora.

The Systemic Risk
AI capital expenditures now contribute more to US economic growth than all consumer spending combined, meaning an OpenAI collapse could trigger broader economic damage. The company's strategy appears to be scaling infrastructure first and figuring out monetization later, despite burning through billions with no clear path to sustainability.

My Take
When a company losing $8 billion annually while serving 95% non-paying users commits $1 trillion to infrastructure buildout, it represents the ultimate expression of AI bubble economics. Altman's admission that profitability isn't a top concern while the broader economy depends on AI capex reveals how disconnected current investment levels are from business fundamentals. The circular financing arrangements and reliance on partners to absorb costs suggest OpenAI knows its unit economics don't work at current scale.

收入现实检查
OpenAI 无法让 95% 的用户相信 ChatGPT 每月价值 20 美元，但他们计划在基础设施上的支出超过许多国家的 GDP。该公司现在正在探索广告、通过 Sora 视频生成获利、在线购物集成，甚至在之前拒绝“性爱机器人”后扭转“成熟应用程序”的方向，以提高参与度。

循环融资网
OpenAI 正在使用英伟达的投资资金购买英伟达芯片，同时依靠甲骨文等合作伙伴来吸收基础设施成本并给他们“时间来建立业务”。高级管理人员承认，他们的五年商业模式“有很多模糊”，没有具体计划将 Sora 等资源密集型产品货币化。

系统性风险
人工智能资本支出现在对美国经济增长的贡献超过了所有消费者支出的总和，这意味着 OpenAI 的崩溃可能会引发更广泛的经济损失。该公司的战略似乎是首先扩大基础设施规模，然后再考虑货币化，尽管已经耗尽了数十亿美元，但没有明确的可持续发展途径。

我的看法
当一家公司在为 95% 的非付费用户提供服务的同时每年亏损 80 亿美元，承诺投入 1 万亿美元用于基础设施建设时，这代表了人工智能泡沫经济学的终极体现。奥特曼承认，盈利能力并不是首要问题，而更广泛的经济依赖于人工智能资本支出，这揭示了当前的投资水平与业务基本面是多么脱节。循环融资安排和依赖合作伙伴来吸收成本表明，OpenAI 知道其单位经济学在当前规模下行不通。

リサーチ→ChatGPT thinking
文章作成→Gemini

法務リサーチでGeminiを使うことはないし、逆にthinkingの文章は相談者への回答文とかには使いづらい。
AIも適材適所が大事なので、少なくともChatGPTとGeminiは両方課金して使い分けるのがおすすめです。あと法務リサーチ多い人はLegalScapeもあり。研究→ChatGPT 思维
双子座→写作

我在法律研究中不使用双子座，相反，思考句很难用于对客户的回答。
人工智能在正确的地方使用正确的人也很重要，因此至少我们建议对 ChatGPT 和 Gemini 收费并单独使用它们。另外，如果你做了很多法律研究，还有 LegalScape。

I don't think this bloatware that can have a high spike of 6 to 7GB of RAM consumption that is also heavily dependant on Edge is worth it, Microsoft

Especially when it's slower and far less efficient than ChatGPT, Grok and DeepSeek我认为这种 RAM 消耗高达 6 到 7GB 且严重依赖 Edge 的过时软件不值得，Microsoft

Sam Altman just committed over $1 trillion to AI infrastructure in the past month alone, while OpenAI lost $8 billion in the first half of 2025 despite doubling revenue. Only 5% of ChatGPT's 800 million users pay for subscriptions, and Altman admits profitability isn't in his "top ten concerns" despite the company's desperate search for new revenue streams.

The Revenue Reality Check
OpenAI can't convince 95% of users that ChatGPT is worth $20 monthly, yet they're planning to spend more than many countries' GDP on infrastructure. The company is now exploring advertising, monetizing Sora video generation, online shopping integration, and even reversing course on "mature apps" to boost engagement after previously rejecting "sexbots."

The Circular Financing Web
OpenAI is using Nvidia investment money to buy Nvidia chips while relying on partners like Oracle to absorb infrastructure costs and give them "time to build the business." Senior executives admit there's "lots of fuzz on the horizon" regarding their five-year business model, with no concrete plan to monetize resource-intensive products like Sora.

The Systemic Risk
AI capital expenditures now contribute more to US economic growth than all consumer spending combined, meaning an OpenAI collapse could trigger broader economic damage. The company's strategy appears to be scaling infrastructure first and figuring out monetization later, despite burning through billions with no clear path to sustainability.

My Take
When a company losing $8 billion annually while serving 95% non-paying users commits $1 trillion to infrastructure buildout, it represents the ultimate expression of AI bubble economics. Altman's admission that profitability isn't a top concern while the broader economy depends on AI capex reveals how disconnected current investment levels are from business fundamentals. The circular financing arrangements and reliance on partners to absorb costs suggest OpenAI knows its unit economics don't work at current scale.

Hedgie  仅在过去一个月，Sam Altman 就刚刚承诺向人工智能基础设施投入超过 1 万亿美元，而 OpenAI 尽管收入翻了一番，但在 2025 年上半年仍亏损了 80 亿美元。ChatGPT 的 8 亿用户中只有 5% 支付订阅费用，Altman 承认，尽管该公司拼命寻找新的收入来源，但盈利能力并不在他的“十大担忧”之列。

收入现实检查
OpenAI 无法让 95% 的用户相信 ChatGPT 每月价值 20 美元，但他们计划在基础设施上的支出超过许多国家的 GDP。该公司现在正在探索广告、通过 Sora 视频生成获利、在线购物集成，甚至在之前拒绝“性爱机器人”后扭转“成熟应用程序”的方向，以提高参与度。

循环融资网
OpenAI 正在使用英伟达的投资资金购买英伟达芯片，同时依靠甲骨文等合作伙伴来吸收基础设施成本并给他们“时间来建立业务”。高级管理人员承认，他们的五年商业模式“有很多模糊”，没有具体计划将 Sora 等资源密集型产品货币化。

系统性风险
人工智能资本支出现在对美国经济增长的贡献超过了所有消费者支出的总和，这意味着 OpenAI 的崩溃可能会引发更广泛的经济损失。该公司的战略似乎是首先扩大基础设施规模，然后再考虑货币化，尽管已经耗尽了数十亿美元，但没有明确的可持续发展途径。

我的看法
当一家公司在为 95% 的非付费用户提供服务的同时每年亏损 80 亿美元，承诺投入 1 万亿美元用于基础设施建设时，这代表了人工智能泡沫经济学的终极体现。奥特曼承认，盈利能力并不是首要问题，而更广泛的经济依赖于人工智能资本支出，这揭示了当前的投资水平与业务基本面是多么脱节。循环融资安排和依赖合作伙伴来吸收成本表明，OpenAI 知道其单位经济学在当前规模下行不通。

Here’s Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, saying the quiet part out loud.

He isn't warning about AI risk. He's managing the public's expectations for a disaster he is actively building.

Let's translate his serene, tech-bro fatalism:

- On AGI: "It will go whooshing by... It won't actually be the singularity."

What he's REALLY saying: "The god-like intelligence we're building will be absorbed so seamlessly into corporate infrastructure that you won't even get to vote on it. The 'revolution' will be a subscription service."

- On Societal Impact: "Society will learn faster... people and societies are all just so much more adaptable than we think."

What he's REALLY saying: "When we disrupt entire industries and erase millions of jobs, you'll just have to 'adapt.' Your pain is a necessary cost for our progress. Be resilient."

- On the Inevitability of Disaster: "I expect some really bad stuff to happen... we'll develop some guardrails around it as a society."

What he's REALLY saying: "We are moving too fast to bother with safety. We will break things, including possibly your society. You, the public, will be left to build the 'guardrails' and clean up the mess after we've already cashed out."

This isn't a warning. It's a confession.

He has admitted his strategy: Deploy first, apologize later. The "fire" he's playing with is an intelligence he doesn't understand, and his business model depends on you getting burned.这是 OpenAI 首席执行官 Sam Altman 大声说出安静的部分。

他并没有警告人工智能风险。他正在管理公众对他正在积极制造的灾难的期望。

让我们翻译一下他平静的、科技兄弟的宿命论：

- 关于 AGI：“它会嗖嗖地过去......它实际上不会是奇点。

他真正在说的是：“我们正在构建的神一样的智能将无缝地吸收到企业基础设施中，以至于你甚至无法对其进行投票。'革命'将是一项订阅服务。

- 关于社会影响：“社会会学得更快......人们和社会的适应性都比我们想象的要强得多。

他真正想说的是：“当我们颠覆整个行业并消除数百万个工作岗位时，你只需要'适应'。您的痛苦是我们进步的必要代价。要有弹性。

- 关于灾难的不可避免性：“我预计会发生一些非常糟糕的事情......作为一个社会，我们将围绕它制定一些护栏。

他真正在说的是：“我们行动太快了，无法为安全而烦恼。我们会破坏一些东西，可能包括你们的社会。你们，公众，在我们兑现后，将不得不建造'护栏'并收拾烂摊子。

这不是警告。这是一个忏悔。

他承认了自己的策略：先部署，后道歉。他玩弄的“火”是他不懂的智能，他的商业模式全靠你被烧伤。

MICHIGAN WOMAN WINS $100K POWERBALL USING NUMBERS FROM CHATGPT

Tammy Carvey, 45, from Wyandotte just proved AI can do everything except guarantee lottery wins - but sometimes it gets close enough.

When the jackpot hit $1 billion, she asked ChatGPT for numbers. 

The AI delivered: four white balls and the Powerball matched, landing her $50,000 that doubled to $100K with Power Play.

"My husband and I were in total disbelief," Carvey said after claiming her prize at Michigan Lottery headquarters. 

She's planning to pay off their home.

Before everyone floods ChatGPT with lottery requests: The odds were still 1 in 913,129. 

The AI didn't crack the lottery code - Carvey just got astronomically lucky with random numbers that happened to come from a chatbot.

Still beats using birthdays and anniversaries like the rest of us suckers.

Source: CBS Detroit  密歇根州女子使用 CHATGPT 的号码赢得 100 美元的强力球

来自怀恩多特的 45 岁的塔米·卡维 （Tammy Carvey） 刚刚证明了人工智能可以做任何事情，除了保证彩票中奖——但有时它已经足够接近了。

当头奖达到 10 亿美元时，她向 ChatGPT 索要数字。

人工智能交付了：四个白球和强力球匹配，她获得了 50,000 美元，通过 Power Play 翻了一番，达到 100 美元。

“我和我丈夫完全难以置信，”卡维在密歇根彩票总部领奖后说。

她正计划还清他们的房子。

在每个人都向 ChatGPT 发送彩票请求之前：几率仍然是 1 分之 913,129。

人工智能没有破解彩票密码——卡维只是天文数字般幸运，随机数字恰好来自聊天机器人。

仍然像我们其他人一样使用生日和周年纪念日。

entries.summary:
好的，这是对本分段推文的分析：

*   AI 商业应用案例 —— 用户明确表示，借助 ChatGPT 为其联盟营销业务创造了 25,000 欧元的价值，这是一个将 AI 工具直接转化为商业高回报的强有力证明；原文：「Merci ChatGPT bordel... 25.000€ UNIQUEMENT pour mes affiliés...」

• AI 对认知能力的负面影响 —— 一项麻省理工学院的研究引发热议，指出使用 ChatGPT 等 AI 工具会抑制大脑活动，导致严重的记忆力衰退和认知卸载，甚至在停止使用后仍有长期伤害；原文：「MIT STUDY: Artificial Intelligence Use Reprograms the Human Brain—Causing Severe Memory Loss and Cognitive Decline ... Even after AI use stopped, brain function remained suppressed—indicating long-term harm.」

• AI 对就业市场的冲击 —— 社区观点显示，对于 AI 和机器人将在未来 2-5 年内导致大规模裁员的担忧情绪正在蔓延；原文：「Fremover vil mange blive fyret pga AI og robotter og vi taler bare om en horisont på 2-5 år」

• UnifAI 的 AI Agents —— 一种 AI 在 Web3/DeFi 领域的应用案例，用户可利用 AI Agents 进行流动性提供（LPing），并即将能够申领 Meteora 积分奖励；原文：「To our amazing users who’ve been LPing with UnifAI’s AI Agents over the past months, you’ll soon be able to export your Agent wallet addresses and claim your Meteora points.」
